title: Wild Man Fischer - An Evening With Wild Man Fischer (1968)
description:
This seems to be a very sought after release. Originally as a double LP on Bizarre/Reprise (I think it was on tape too), and produced by Mr. Zappa. The demented musical musings contained herein were thought up and performed by Larry "Wild Man" Fischer, who is a certified paranoid-schizophrenic (hey! We have something in common!) was "discovered" by Frank Zappa while performing his freakishly insane ditties on a street corner and offered to sell him a song. Frank thought that Wild Man was a genius and made a record with him!!! They were pretty good friends for a while. I&#039;ve heard that Wild Man threw a glass bottle at baby Moon-Unit! I don&#039;t think they were friends after that. Anywho, I here is Wild Man in all his Wild Glory! Saddle up your fiber-glass molded and lead-paint painted horses and MERRY-GO-MERRY-GO-MERRYGOROUND!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


An Evening With Wild Man Fischer (2 LP)
Wild Man Fischer

Released: April 28, 1968
Label: Bizarre/Reprise
Catalog Number: 2XS 6332
Produced by Frank Zappa

Tracklisting:
1. Merry-Go-Round 
2. New Kind of Songs For Sale
3. "I&#039;m Not Shy Anymore!" 
4. "Are You From Clovis?"
5. The Madness And The Ecstacy
6. Which Way Did the Freaks Go?
7. I&#039;m Working For the Federal Bureau of Narcotics
8. The Leaves Are Falling
9. 85 Times
10. Cops & Robbers
11. Monkeys Versus Donkeys
12. Start Life Over Again
13. The Mope
14. Life Brand New
15. Who Did It Johnny?
16. Think of Me When Your Clothes Are Off
17. Taggy Lee
18. Rhonda
19. I Looked Around You
20. Jennifer Jones
21. The Taster
22. The Story of The Taster
23. The Rocket Rock
24. The Rocket Rock Explanation & Dialog
25. Dream Girl
26. Dream Girl Explanation
27. Serrano (Sorrento?) Beach
28. Success Will Not Make Me Happy
29. Wild Man On The Strip Again
30. Why I Am Normal
31. The Wild Man Fischer Story
32. Balling Isn&#039;t Everything
33. Ugly Beautiful Girl
34. Larry & His Guitar
35. Circle (Larry&#039;s first psychedelic hit)
36. Larry Under Pressure

1.3 Hours, MP3- 128 Kb/s

produced by Frank Zappa
engineered by Jerry Hansen at Sunset Sound Studios, Hollywood
street field recording by Dick Kunc
words and music on all songs by Larry Fischer
business production: Herb Cohen
Copyright 1968 by Bizarre Music Co. BMI

Musicians:
Larry Fischer - Vocal
Rodney Bingenheimer - Vocal
Kim Fowley - Vocal
GTO&#039;s - Vocals
Artie Tripp - Percussion
